import os
import random
import cv2
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
source.5ce8db11:
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    print(dirname)
source.55065584:
img = cv2.imread(os.path.join('/kaggle/input/few-shot-object-detection/train/images', random_file))
img = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_BGR2RGB) 
f = open(os.path.join('/kaggle/input/few-shot-object-detection/train/labels', random_file.replace("jpg", "txt")))
for line in f:
    x1, y1, x2, y2 = line.split()
    cv2.rectangle(img, (int(x1),int(y1)), (int(x2),int(y2)), (255,0,0), 4)
source.7a9db51e:
img = cv2.imread(os.path.join('/kaggle/input/few-shot-object-detection/test/images', random_file_test))
img = cv2.cvtColor(img, cv2.COLOR_BGR2RGB) 
plt.imshow(img)
source.e4eff975:
This is a newer version of the Starter Notebook. 
We have changed the dataset, particularly, the test-set (so all your models that were trained previously can still be used)

There was some errors while calculating mAP for multiple objects in a single frame. We have limited the number of objects to 1-object per image. 
The new evaluation scheme is the Multi-Column-Root-Mean-Square Error. (the Lower the better)

As a result, the submission file is changed as well. This notebook should guide you to create a output csv file for submission on Kaggle. 

Hope you don't face much errors in the rest of the competition.
source.cbc20979: Generating the csv file for submission
source.2f4b3a08:
Everything runs smoothly, but the problem is you can't see your file anywhere in this page, nor in your Profile, Kernels tab, nowhere! This is because you haven't commited your notebook yet. To do that, click the Commit button - as I write it, this is a light-blue button in the top-right corner of my notebook page, in the main pane. (There is also a right pane with Sessions, Versions etc. You can ignore it for now). It may take a minute for the Kaggle server to publish your notebook.

When this operation is done, you can go back by clicking '<<' button in the top-left corner. Then you should see your notebook with a top bar that has a few tabs: Notebook, Code, Data, Output, Comments, Log ... Edit Notebook. Click the Output tab. You should see your output csv file there, ready to download and submit on Kaggle!
